content:
Diagnosis
	1. Squamous cell carcinoma of left temple region with regional lymph node involvement

	Date of diagnosis
	February 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Feb 2024 Wide local excision with involved margin
	Regional lymph node dissection showing 2/8 nodes positive

	Radiotherapy
	Not yet commenced

	Chemotherapy
	Not yet commenced

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Residual disease at primary site with nodal involvement

	Current issues
	Post-surgical wound healing well

	Summary of consultation
	This case was discussed at today's Head & Neck MDT. The patient is a 67-year-old gentleman with a left temple region squamous cell carcinoma, initially excised on 15th February 2024 showing a 4.2cm lesion with 2mm deep margin involvement. Subsequent nodal dissection revealed 2/8 positive nodes, largest 12mm with extracapsular spread. PD-L1 testing shows high expression (CPS 85).

Imaging shows no evidence of distant metastatic disease but there is residual enhancement at the primary site suggesting incomplete excision.

After detailed discussion, the MDT recommends:
1. Re-excision of primary site
2. Following healing, to commence adjuvant chemoradiotherapy with weekly cisplatin
3. Consider pembrolizumab based on high PD-L1 expression following completion of primary therapy

	Further investigations
	Repeat CT head/neck/chest in 3 months

	Medication prescribed
	None

	Follow up
	Urgent referral to plastic surgery for re-excision
Review in combined head and neck clinic in 2 weeks

	Required GP actions
	None at present

	Summary of information given to the patient
	MDT outcome to be discussed at next clinic visit

primary_cancer.metastases: 2/8 positive lymph nodes with extracapsular spread
primary_cancer.histopathology_status: 4.2cm squamous cell carcinoma with 2mm deep margin involvement

cancer_timeline.value: Wide local excision with involved margin and regional lymph node dissection showing 2/8 nodes positive
Imaging shows residual enhancement at primary site suggesting incomplete excision, no distant metastases

status_updates.value: Stage III left temple SCC with positive margins and nodal involvement. MDT recommends re-excision followed by adjuvant chemoradiotherapy.
MDT recommends re-excision followed by adjuvant chemoradiotherapy with weekly cisplatin, consideration of pembrolizumab
Urgent referral to plastic surgery for re-excision and review in combined head and neck clinic in 2 weeks
